meanings.definition: To rush or move upward quickly.
meanings.sent1: The water began uprushing from the fountain.
meanings.sent2: She uprushed to catch the falling book.
meanings.sent3: The balloons uprushed into the sky during the festival.
meanings.sent4: His excitement uprushed like a geyser when he won the race.
meanings.sent5: The flames uprushed, engulfing the entire building in seconds.

meanings.definition: The act of rushing or moving upward quickly.
meanings.sent1: The uprushing of the elevator startled the passengers.
meanings.sent2: The uprushing of the hot air balloon was breathtaking.
meanings.sent3: The uprushing of laughter filled the room during the comedy show.
meanings.sent4: The uprushing of emotions overwhelmed her at the surprise party.
meanings.sent5: The uprushing of cheers echoed through the stadium after the winning goal.
